data.text:
Paris: Librairie Paul Ollendorff / Société d'Éditions Littéraires et Artistiques, 1913. Very Good. Item #6956

Paris: Librairie Paul Ollendorff / Société d'Éditions Littéraires et Artistiques, 1913. Second Edition. Small octavo (18.5cm.); contemporary red cloth, gilt-lettered spine; [2],302pp.; photographic frontispiece. Spine a bit faded, textblock uniformly toned, contemporary ownership inscription in pencil on front flyleaf, else Very Good and sound. Account of the life and works of the French novelist and mystic Romain Rolland, who would be awarded the Nobel Prize for Literature in 1915.
